掔字的基本解释

掔
qiān
固紧；使牢固：“令命昏纬狗，纂马，掔纬。”
除去。
厚实；坚实。
击。
古通“牵”，牵引：“郑襄公肉袒掔羊以迎。”

掔
wàn
古同“腕”：“莫不搤掔而自言有禁方能神仙矣。”

掔字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiān］
［《廣韻》苦堅切，平先，溪。］
［《廣韻》苦閑切，平山，溪。］
亦作“孯1”。
(1)坚固；坚守。
(2)牵引。
(3)引去；除去。
[②]［wàn］
亦作“孯2”。同“腕1”。

掔字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　掔； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页437第16
【唐韻】苦閑切【集韻】【正韻】丘閑切，?音慳。【說文】固也。【爾雅·釋詁】厚也。　又【唐韻】【正韻】苦堅切【集韻】輕煙切，?音牽。義同。　又牽去也。與牽通。【史記·鄭世家】鄭襄公肉袒，掔羊以迎。【莊子·徐無鬼】君將黜耆欲，掔好惡，則耳目病矣。　又持也。擊也。　又【正韻】詰戰切，遣去聲。挽也，引也。俗作?。　【說文】讀若詩赤舄掔掔。【徐鉉曰】今別作慳，非。○按豳風作几几。《說文》或別有所考。長箋云：掔掔句似逸詩，則鑿矣。

掔字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
掔字的起名意思

本意是使牢固，也有厚实，坚实之义。

Basic explanation of words
lead along
qiān
To tighten; to make it firm: "Command the dog to stun the weft, compile the horse, and hold the weft."
Remove.
Thick; solid.
hit.
Gutong "leads" and pulls: "Zheng Xianggong greets the sheep with meat."
lead along
wàn
Gu Tong's "wrist": "Don't be frustrated and say that there is a forbidden to be a god."
lead along
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiān］
["Guangyun" bitter and hard cut, flat first, stream. ]
["Guangyun" bittersweet cutting, flat mountains, streams. ]
Also known as "孯1".
(1) Sturdy; persevere.
(2) Traction.
(3) Lead away; remove.
[②]［wàn］
Also known as "孯2". Same as "Wrist 1".

[Mao Collection] [Hand Character Department] 　掔; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 437-16
[Tang Yun] bitter and free cut [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] Qiu free cut, sound saving. [Said the text] solid also. 【Erya · Shi Xuan】 Thick too.　[Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun] bitter and hard cut [Ji Yun] light smoke cut,? Sound leads. The same meaning.　Take it away again. Connected with. [Historical Records·The Family of Zheng] Zheng Xianggong was naked and greeted with sheep. [Zhuangzi·Xu Wugui] The ruler will deprive him of desire and dislike his likes and dislikes, but his eyes and ears will become ill.　Hold it again. Hit also.　 [Zheng Yun] Cross-examination and cutting, sending away sound. Pull also, lead also. Popular work?.　【Said the text】Reading if you are poems, you will be awkward. [Xu Xuan said] Don’t save money today, no. ○Make a few according to Binfeng. "Said Wen" may not be tested. The long note goes: If a sentence is like an easy poem, it will be awkward.

Old glyph
lead along
Name meaning
The original intention is to make it firm, but it also has the meaning of thick and solid.
qiān
I прил./наречие
твёрдый; прочный; плотный
掔纬 * прочно связать
II гл.
1) * вм. 牵 (тянуть, тащить)
2) отказываться, отступиться
掔好(hào)恶(wù) отступиться от своих симпатий и антипатий
3) * бить, ударять
